page.title: 14RELIGION
page.content: There are three Anglican churches located in the defined area.They are at{Little Washbourne,Alstone & {Teddington}and all were established in the 13th.century or before.The church at Little Washbourne was declared redundant in 1973.It is now used only for the Alstone Sunday School's annual picnic,curious passing tourists and trysting lovers.The villages have no resident vicar and have to share the services with the main churches of { Overbury and Beckford}which is just outside this block. The main Christian festivals are celebrated in these two churches but marriages involving larger congregations are held at Overbury. However,baptisms and funerals are still observed in the local parish churches.
